subject: Economics
title: Karl Marx: The Economist Who Changed History
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Karl Marx: The Economist Who Changed History.

hook.text: A broke journalist sitting in the British Library wrote a book that inspired revolutions on every continent.

buildup.text: Marx argued that capitalism exploits workers: they create value but owners keep the profit.

discovery.text: Marx predicted capitalism would concentrate wealth until workers revolted.

twist.text: Every communist revolution happened in poor, agricultural countries â€” the opposite of what Marx predicted.

climax.text: Marx was wrong about the revolution but arguably right about concentration.

punchline.text: Marx's worst predictions shaped the 20th century more than anyone's best ones.

quiz.question: What did Marx predict would happen to capitalism?
options: Wealth concentration would grow until workers revolted and overthrew the system
